titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Upcott, Original Letters
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:57
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: "Original letters collected by William Upcott of the London Institution. Marquesses. Second series."

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Autograph MSS.
Letters mounted in an album.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn d195 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Upcott, Original letters. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn d195. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

did.unittitle: ABERCORN, ANNE JANE HAMILTON, MARCHIONESS OF, 1763-1827
AL (in third person) to Kent and Luck, firm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Green St.
1 p.; 18 x 12 cm.
Requests that her carpet be put down.
d 195/2

did.unittitle: AL (in third person) to Lackington and Co., booksellers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Grosvenor Square
1 p.; 23 x 19 cm.

"History of Antient Wiltshire" by
Sir Richard Colt Hoare, 2nd bart.
(1758-1838).
d 195/4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Jan 24, [Petersham]

apparently near to her death; she
discusses her personal health and
her present situation; the tone of
the letter is one of desperation.
d.195/30x

did.unittitle: ELY, ANNA MARIA (DASHWOOD) LOFTUS, MARCHIONESS OF, 1785-1857
AL to Cadell and Davies, publishers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Windsor Castle
1 p.; 22 x 18 cm.

(1768-1840) and Princess Elizabeth,
princess of England and landgravine
of Heese-Homburg (1770-1840), she
requests a copy of the poem
"Wallace" by Margaret (Holford)
Hodson (1778-1852).
d.195/46
